content.text: 1 Write the number twenty thousand in figures
3 Write down all the factors of 18
5 (a) On the diagram, draw all the lines of symmetry
(b) Shade one square so that the diagram has rotational symmetry of order 2
6 Find the value of the reciprocal of 0.25
8 Write these numbers in order, starting with the smallest
Work out the time the film finishes
(a) Find the area of the shape
(b) On the grid, shade \(50 \%\) of the shape
10 A shape is drawn on a \(1 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\) grid
12 (a) Kat has a method for finding the difference between two square numbers, \(a^{2}-b^{2}\). Her method is
(the sum of \(a\) and \(b) \times\) (the difference between \(a\) and \(b)\)
(b) In this part, all lengths are in centimetres
Work out the volume of the prism
(b) Show that the length of \(BC\) is 5 cm
(c) Complete the net of the prism on the 1 \(\mathrm{cm}^{2}\) grid
The base has been drawn for you
The diagram shows a triangular prism
\(ABC\) is an isosceles triangle with \(AC = BC\)
The perpendicular height of triangle \(ABC\) is 4 cm
(a) Write down the mathematical name for triangle \(BCD\)
Give two geometrical reasons for your answer
The diagram shows a triangle \(BCD\) and a straight line \(ABC\). \(DB = DC = BC\)
(a) What type of correlation is shown in the scatter diagram?
(b) Describe the relationship between the temperature and the number of people on the beach
16 Jill records the temperature and the number of people on a beach for each of ten days. The results are shown in the scatter diagram
(a) Find the equation of line \(L\) in the form \(y=m x+c\)
17 Line \(L\) is shown on the grid
18 (a) Complete the table of values for \(y=\frac{12}{x}\)
(b) On the grid, draw the graph of \(y=\frac{12}{x}\) for \(-6 \leqslant x \leqslant-1\) and \(1 \leqslant x \leqslant 6\)
(c) On the grid, draw the line \(y=-9\)
Write down the values of \(n\) that satisfy \(7<n \leqslant 15\)
Pip thinks \(-1<x<8\) is the inequality represented on the number line
Pip's inequality is not correct because
20 The height, \(h\) metres, of a building is \(635 \mathrm{~m}\), correct to the nearest metre
Complete this statement about the value of \(h\)
(a) Find the value of \(X\) when \(w=5\) and \(p=6\)
(b) Make \(p\) the subject of the formula
Give your answer as a fraction in its simplest form
(b) Find the probability that Mai buys two faulty batteries
(c) A shop sells 3000 batteries in one month
Work out the expected number of faulty batteries the shop sells
The probability that a battery is faulty is \(\frac{1}{10}\)
The circumference of the circle is the same length as the perimeter of the square
Give your answer in terms of \(\pi\)
Triangle \(ABC\) is mathematically similar to triangle \(PQR\)
